english.segment1: Ive been there. Its more than just stress. Oh, that you had the wings of a dove. You would fly away and rest (Psalm 55:6)
english.segment2: Weeping may last for the night. The longest night of your life. But I can promise you that. Rejoicing comes in the morning (Psalm 30:5)
english.segment3: Are you broken?. Are you dismayed?. You know you did the best you could do. But it ended up this way (Psalm 73:13 23-26)
english.segment4: Weeping may last for the night. The longest night of your life. But I can promise you that. Rejoicing comes in the morning
english.segment5: You will both lay down in peace, and you will sleep (Psalm 4:8). Where morning dawns and evening fades God calls forth songs of joy (Psalm 65:8). Hell sing to you and quiet you with love (Zephaniah 3:17)
english.segment6: I know you feel. You wont last another day. But when the fires of life arise. You will walk on through unscathed (Isaiah 43:2)
english.segment7: Weeping may last for the night. The longest night of your life. But I can promise you that. Rejoicing comes in the morning
